definition[0]: making you feel pleased and happy, especially because you have got what you wanted
example[1]: It can be very satisfying to work in the garden.
definition[1]: food that is satisfying makes you feel that you have eaten enough
definition[2]: making you feel satisfied, because you have got or achieved something you wanted
example[3]: Thereâ€™s something very satisfying about baking your own bread.
definition[3]: satisfying, because you feel you are doing something useful for yourself or for other people
example[5]: Nursing is a very rewarding job.
example[6]: It's been hard work, but very rewarding.
definition[4]: making you feel satisfied and happy with your life, because you are using your abilities in a useful way. Fulfilling and rewarding are very close in meaning. Fulfilling is used more about your feelings about your life in general, and that something makes you feel a happier person
example[7]: We want to provide a more fulfilling life for people who are mentally ill.
example[8]: a happier and more fulfilling relationship
example[9]: What should be a happy and fulfilling experience all too often is not.
definition[5]: making you feel pleased and satisfied, because something is good
example[10]: The results of the training scheme were very pleasing.
definition[6]: making you feel pleased and satisfied, especially because people like what you have done, or you feel that you were right about something
example[11]: Their enthusiastic reception of his paintings was very gratifying.
example[12]: It's gratifying to know that these videos are appreciated.
example[13]: It is extremely gratifying to hear that something I did affected someone's life in such a positive way.
